newsitem.title: INDIA: At least 16 killed as train rams bus in India.
newsitem.headline: At least 16 killed as train rams bus in India.

text.p: At least 16 people were killed and 57 injured when a passenger train hit a bus at an open railway crossing in central India on Sunday, officials said.
The accident occurred near Guna, some 160 km (100 miles) northwest of the Madhya Pradesh state capital Bhopal.
"Sixteen people have died and another 57 have been injured in the accident," K.D.P. Rao, a senior district official, told Reuters by telephone.
Rao said the train smashed into the bus and carried it along for nearly 100 metres. All the dead were travelling on the bus.
"There were no passengers on the train as it was only a locomotive with a couple of wagons," Rao said.
He said the condition of 16 of the injured was serious and they had been shifted to hospitals in Bhopal and Gwalior.
"Eight people have been moved to Bhopal and another eight have been shifted to Gwalior," he added.
An enquiry has been ordered into the accident, Rao said.
